results.title: Scottish Premiership: What did we learn from the weekend's games?

results.description: Despite an early red card, Hamilton hold on for more than an hour to take a point from Kilmarnock. (UK only)
results.title: Highlights: Kilmarnock 2-2 Hamilton Academical

results.description: Hamilton Accies let a two-goal lead slip at Kilmarnock after Sam Stubbs' red card but held on to secure a point.
results.title: Kilmarnock 2-2 Hamilton Academical: Ten-man Accies hold Kilmarnock

results.description: Catch up with all the team news and stats for the six games taking place before the international break, and choose your preferred XI.
results.title: Scottish Premiership team news, stats & selectors

results.description: Kilmarnock defender Stuart Findlay will be out for "a minimum" of three months with a hamstring injury, manager Angelo Alessio has confirmed.
results.shortTitle: Kilmarnock's Findlay to miss three months
results.title: Kilmarnock: Stuart Findlay out for three months - Angelo Alessio

thumbnail.altText: Stuart Findlay was injured in the win over St Mirren

results.description: Police confirm a total of 13 men and boys have now been arrested and charged after the 4 August game.
results.shortTitle: Rugby Park incidents: Total of 13 arrested
results.title: Kilmarnock-Rangers incidents: Total of 13 arrested

results.description: Curtis Main scores his first goal for Aberdeen as they ease aside Kilmarnock at Pittodrie. (UK only)
results.title: Highlights: Aberdeen 3-0 Kilmarnock

results.description: Aberdeen ease to victory over injury and suspension hit Kilmarnock, with Sam Cosgrove scoring his 16th goal of the season.
results.title: Aberdeen 3-0 Kilmarnock: Hosts ease to victory over makeshift visitors

results.description: Kilmarnock defender Alex Bruce will miss Saturday's Premiership trip to Aberdeen after his appeal against his sending off in the defeat to Motherwell was dismissed.
results.title: Kilmarnock defender Bruce's appeal dismissed

results.description: Kilmarnock plan to appeal Alex Bruce's red card in their 2-1 defeat by Motherwell, but did the centre-half really commit a foul?
results.shortTitle: Kilmarnock's Bruce sent off against Motherwell
results.title: Watch: Should Kilmarnock's Alex Bruce have been sent off against Motherwell?

results.description: Devante Cole hits the winner for Motherwell against 10-man Kilmarnock as the Fir Park side move back into third place in the Scottish Premiership.
results.title: Highlights: Motherwell 2-1 Kilmarnock

results.description: Motherwell reclaim third place in the Scottish Premiership from 10-man Kilmarnock after defeating Angelo Alessio's side 2-1.
results.shortTitle: Motherwell move third with win over 10-man Killie
results.title: Motherwell 2-1 Kilmarnock: Hosts defeat 10-man visitors to go third

results.title: Midweek Scottish Premiership team news, stats & selectors

results.description: Kilmarnock defender Stephen O'Donnell intends to wait until the end of the season before deciding where his future lies.
results.shortTitle: O'Donnell to hold off on Kilmarnock deal
results.title: Kilmarnock: Stephen O'Donnell to hold off on contract decision

results.description: Gary Dicker's goal beats St Mirren and moves Kilmarnock up to third in the Scottish Premiership. (UK only)
results.title: Highlights: Kilmarnock 1-0 St Mirren

results.description: Kilmarnock move up to third in the Scottish Premiership after Gary Dicker's second goal in two games is enough to beat St Mirren at Rugby Park.
results.shortTitle: Kilmarnock up to third after Dicker goal
results.title: Kilmarnock 1-0 St Mirren: Hosts up to third in Premiership after Gary Dicker goal

thumbnail.altText: Gary Dicker celebrates his goal for Kilmarnock

results.description: After a stuttering start to his tenure, Angelo Alessio can lift Kilmarnock up to third with victory on Saturday. BBC Scotland examines how the Italian has improved the club's fortunes.
results.shortTitle: How has Alessio turned it around at Kilmarnock?
results.title: Kilmarnock: How has Angelo Alessio turned around the club's Scottish Premiership form?

thumbnail.altText: Angelo Alessio's side have only lost one of their last seven league games
